column4: when i installed ubuntu i did 2 partitions, root (25gb) and onee another partition (not swap, nor i cant remember what it was) with 135gb, which doesnt show up now and i cant use it... any way tofix that?
if it doesn't show up with df,  cat /proc/partitions and then add teh 135GB partition to fstab (if ti's already formatted)
alright, now slowly :D what is df?
man df
kay... and /proc/partitions is empty
if it's empty you can't run linux cause: you don't have any partitions to run from. so please rethink that statement
:)))) lol, but... ehm thats the file which opened with text editor, isnt it? and its blank sheet
cat /proc/partitions
it wrote me smth
so after i made df it got me some kind of info, whats next? :D
i mean... how do i partition my free space?
use gparted
k will install it now
and you said you partitioned it already. so is that 135GB partition showing in /proc/partitions or not?
nope. i thought i partioned it when i installed linux
seems that i had only formatted it
then i did partition it. nvm. ive run gparted and i have 2 partitions
one is "/" and another is "/ush" which is for an unknown reason to me is particulary used (4gb)
so why isn't it showing in /proc/partitions? also what is the output of df ?
ah wait, it is showing in /proc/partitions
ah well found it, tho its unusualy to me that it is in /usr folder :)
unusual*.. thanks for ur time and help
